canvas

Class Layer

  • java.lang.Object
    • canvas.Layer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Layer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A layer is the container of one or more shapes. A layer can lay over or under other layers. It can be toggled visible or invisible.
    See Also:
    Shape, Canvas, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Layer()
      Default constructor.
      Layer(java.util.List<Shape> shapes)
      The constructor of the Layer Class.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getHTML()
      Returns the containers of each Shape in the layer.
      java.util.List<Shape> getShapes()
      Returns the List of Shape which are in the layer.
      boolean isVisible()
      Returns true or false depending on the visibility of the layer.
      void setVisible(boolean visible)
      Sets the visibility true or false.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Layer

        public Layer()
        Default constructor. This gets called whenever the user adds a new layer. It is set visible, even though the user can't see it because it doesn't have any shape in it.

      • Layer

        public Layer(java.util.List<Shape> shapes)
        The constructor of the Layer Class. It expects one or more shapes, which then get assigned to the layer.
        Parameters:
        shapes - a List of Shape

    • Method Detail

      • getShapes

        public java.util.List<Shape> getShapes()
        Returns the List of Shape which are in the layer. This gets called whenever the user adds, deletes or edits a shape.
        Returns:
        returns a List of Layer

      • isVisible

        public boolean isVisible()
        Returns true or false depending on the visibility of the layer.
        Returns:
        returns a Boolean

      • setVisible

        public void setVisible(boolean visible)
        Sets the visibility true or false. This gets called when the user toggles the visibility of the layer.
        Parameters:
        visible - If true, makes the Layer visible; if false invisible.

      • getHTML

        public java.lang.String getHTML()
        Returns the containers of each Shape in the layer. Gets called by Canvas "getHTML" method.
        Returns:
        returns a Shape containing all HTML containers of the shapes
